cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles NW of Great Inagua Island and 340 miles SE of Nassau
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest through the Bahamas, then forecast to skirt the east coast of Florida before turning north-northwest toward the southeast U.S. coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northwestern/central Bahamas, with a possible close coastal brush along Florida’s east coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: East coast of Florida from Ocean Reef to Sebastian Inlet and Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings in effect for the southeastern, central, and northwestern Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Bahamas, Turks & Caicos, east coast of Florida, and the Southeast U.S. coastline up through the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Peripheral bands could bring occasional gusts 25–35 mph late Saturday into Sunday; tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (≤ 7 %).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Tampa Bay because the storm remains on the Atlantic side of the peninsula.
weather_observation.rainfall: Intermittent showers, generally 1–2 inches possible; widespread heavy rainfall not expected.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minimal – routine marine operations may see higher Atlantic swells, but Gulf waters near the port remain largely undisturbed.
